comment:
* Representation of an entry on the fragment back stack, as created * with {@link FragmentTransaction#addToBackStack(String) * FragmentTransaction.addToBackStack()}. Entries can later be * retrieved with {@link FragmentManager#getBackStackEntryAt(int) * FragmentManager.getBackStackEntryAt()}. * *

Note that you should never hold on to a BackStackEntry object; * the identifier as returned by {@link #getId} is the only thing that * will be persisted across activity instances. * * @deprecated Use the * Support Library {@link androidx.fragment.app.FragmentManager.BackStackEntry}

methods.name: public int getId()
methods.comment:
* Return the unique identifier for the entry.  This is the only
         * representation of the entry that will persist across activity
         * instances.

methods.name: public String getName()
methods.comment:
* Get the name that was supplied to
         * {@link FragmentTransaction#addToBackStack(String)
         * FragmentTransaction.addToBackStack(String)} when creating this entry.

methods.name: public int getBreadCrumbTitleRes()
methods.comment:
* Return the full bread crumb title resource identifier for the entry,
         * or 0 if it does not have one.

methods.name: public int getBreadCrumbShortTitleRes()
methods.comment:
* Return the short bread crumb title resource identifier for the entry,
         * or 0 if it does not have one.

methods.name: public CharSequence getBreadCrumbTitle()
methods.comment:
* Return the full bread crumb title for the entry, or null if it
         * does not have one.

methods.name: public CharSequence getBreadCrumbShortTitle()
methods.comment:
* Return the short bread crumb title for the entry, or null if it
         * does not have one.
